newsitem.title: UK: BA cancels 14 flights ahead of strike.
newsitem.headline: BA cancels 14 flights ahead of strike.

text.p: British Airways Plc said on Tuesday it had cancelled 14 flights as 350 staff reported sick ahead of tomorrow's planned three-day strike by cabin crew.
The cancelled flights were all at Heathrow to domestic and short-haul European destinations. BA said it was doing its best to transfer passengers to other BA services or on to rival airlines.
The cancellations come on the eve of industrial action, sparked by a breakdown of talks between BA and cabin crew over pay and conditions.
BA said Wednesday's strike looked almost certain to go ahead from 0500 GMT tomorrow.
"We're working on the assumption that there will be a strike and we're doing our best to minimise the impact on our customers," a BA spokeswoman told Reuters.
British travel agents reported on Tuesday they had been flooded with calls from travellers trying to find alternative flights on rival airlines before tomorrow.
Unless a solution is found soon, the Transport and General Workers Union (T&G), the main union involved in the strike, is threatening to call further strikes.

"There will be more strikes unless BA comes to an agreement with the unions," said T&G spokesman Andrew Murray, who noted that the strikers had received "tremendous solidarity" from foreign aviation unions who support their dispute.
